persons.name: Jean-AndréDeluc
persons.description: Swiss-born geologist, natural philosopher and meteorologist who spent much of his time working in England. FRSL.

places.name: United States
places.description: The U.S. is a country of 50 states covering a vast swath of North America, with Alaska in the northwest and Hawaii extending the nation’s presence into the Pacific Ocean.

places.name: France
places.description: France, officially the French Republic, is a country located primarily in Western Europe.

places.name: New Holland
places.description: New Holland was the name first given to Australia by the Dutch seafarer, Abel Tasman.

places.name: Mull
places.description: The Isle of Mull is the second-largest island of the Inner Hebrides (after Skye) and lies off the west coast of Scotland.

places.name: Logan Rock
places.description: a ninety-ton granite boulder perched on the edge of the cliffs overlooking the English Channel, on a headland one mile south of Treen.

places.name: Aswan
places.description: a city in Southern Egypt, previously known as the ancient city of Swenett, later known as Syene, which in antiquity was the frontier town of Ancient Egypt facing the south.

places.name: River Ayr
places.description: a river in Ayrshire, Scotland; the longest river in that country.

places.name: Ben Nevis
places.description: the highest mountain in Scotland, the United Kingdom and the British Isles.

places.name: Cornwall
places.description: Cornwall is a county in south-west England, birthplace of Humphry Davy.

places.name: Lizard Point
places.description: The Lizard is a peninsula of the southern coast of Cornwall. It is the most southerly point of the British mainland. The geology of the Lizard is complex: it contains some of Cornwall's oldest (Precambrian) rocks, as well as heavily metamorphosed rocks.

places.name: Padstow
places.description: a town and fishing port on the north coast of Cornwall, England

places.name: Cornwall
places.description: Cornwall is a county in south-west England, birthplace of Humphry Davy.

places.name: Ben Nevis
places.description: the highest mountain in Scotland, the United Kingdom and the British Isles.

places.name: Alps
places.description: The Alps are the highest and most extensive mountain range that lies entirely in Europe. They are located in eight European countries.

places.name: Mont Blanc
places.description: Mont Blanc is the highest mountain in the Alps and Western Europe, and the highest mountain in Europe outside the Caucasus Mountains.

places.name: St Michael's Mount
places.description: St Michael's Mount is a tidal island in Mount's Bay, Cornwall, with a distinct conical shape.

places.name: Cornwall
places.description: Cornwall is a county in south-west England, birthplace of Humphry Davy.

persons.name: Abraham GottlobWerner
persons.description: German geologist who proposed the theory of Neptunism and who also proposed the chronological sequence found in stratified rocks.

persons.name: JamesHutton
persons.description: Scottish geologist, agriculturalist and chemical manufacturer. His Theory of the Earth (1795) is one of the foundations of modern geology. Davy discussed Hutton's theories in his lectures and visited some of the key geological sites that Hutton used in his work.

persons.name: RichardKirwan
persons.description: Irish chemist, mineralogist and geologist who accused fellow geologist, James Hutton, of athiesm following publication of his Theory of the Earth (1788). FRSL

persons.name: IsaacNewton
persons.description: Prominent English natural philosopher and mathematician greatly admired by Davy who once under the influence of several litres of nitrous oxide wrote in his notebook 'Davy & Newton' in one inch letters. FRSL.

places.name: Pyrenees
places.description: The Pyrenees mountain range separates the Iberian Peninsula from the rest of Europe, stretching more than 430km between Spain and France and rising higher than 3,400m in elevation.

places.name: Swiss Alps
places.description: The Alpine region of Switzerland, conventionally referred to as the Swiss Alps, extend over both the Western Alps and the Eastern Alps, encompassing an area sometimes called Central Alps.

places.name: Alps
places.description: The Alps are the highest and most extensive mountain range that lies entirely in Europe. They are located in eight European countries.

places.name: Africa
places.description: The world's second-largest and second-most populous continent.
